snippet: Lehigh University, in an attempt to foster innovation, is offering a program with no course credit, no set curriculum and no penalty for failure.
abstract: Lehigh University, in eastern Pennsylvania, offers what it calls mountaintop program that combines research, work experience and independent, long-form projects to students over summer, in hope that program will help foster innovation; students choose their own projects and find their own way, with little faculty input and nothing more at stake than testing their own ambition, skills and curiosity.
lead_paragraph: Lehigh University, in an attempt to foster innovation, is offering a program with no course credit, no set curriculum and no penalty for failure.

headline.main: A Classroom Leaves the Syllabus to the Students
